com.cpaas.resources

Class Twofactor

  • java.lang.Object
    • TwofactorDeserializer
      • com.cpaas.resources.Twofactor

  • public class Twofactor
extends TwofactorDeserializer
    CPaaS provides Authentication API where a two-factor authentication (2FA) flow can be implemented by using that. Sections below describe two sample use cases, two-factor authentication via SMS and two-factor authentication via e-mail

    • Constructor Detail

      • Twofactor

        public Twofactor(Api api)

    • Method Detail

      • sendCode

        public Twofactor sendCode(JSONObject params)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new authentication code
        Parameters:
        params - JSONObject to hold all params.
        params.destinationAddress - Array[String] | String Destination address of the authentication code being sent. For sms type authentication codes, it should contain a E164 phone number. For e-mail type authentication codes, it should contain a valid e-mail address.
        params.message - String Message text sent to the destination, containing the placeholder for the code within the text. CPaaS requires to have *{code}* string within the text in order to generate a code and inject into the text. For email type code, one usage is to have the *{code}* string located within the link in order to get a unique link.
        params.subject - String Optional When the method is passed as email then subject is a mandatory field to pass. The value passed becomes the subject line of the 2FA code email that is sent out to the destinationAddress.
        params.method - String Optional Default - sms. Type of the authentication code delivery method, sms and email are supported types. Possible values: sms, email
        params.expiry - String Optional Default - 120. Lifetime duration of the code sent in seconds. This can contain values between 30 and 3600 seconds.
        params.length - String Optional Default - 6. Length of the authentication code tha CPaaS should generate for this request. It can contain values between 4 and 10.
        params.type - String Optional Default - "numeric". Type of the code that is generated. If not provided, default value is numeric. Possible values: numeric, alphanumeric, alphabetic
        Returns:
        Twofactor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception raised

      • verifyCode

        public Twofactor verifyCode(JSONObject params)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        params - JSONObject to hold all params.
        params.codeId - String ID of the authentication code.
        params.verificationCode - String Code that is being verified.
        Returns:
        Twofactor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception raised

      • resendCode

        public Twofactor resendCode(JSONObject params)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new authentication code
        Parameters:
        params - JSONObject to hold all params.
        params.codeId - String ID of the authentication code.
        params.destinationAddress - Array[String] | String Destination address of the authentication code being sent. For sms type authentication codes, it should contain a E164 phone number. For e-mail type authentication codes, it should contain a valid e-mail address.
        params.message - String Message text sent to the destination, containing the placeholder for the code within the text. CPaaS requires to have *{code}* string within the text in order to generate a code and inject into the text. For email type code, one usage is to have the *{code}* string located within the link in order to get a unique link.
        params.subject - String Optional When the method is passed as email then subject is a mandatory field to pass. The value passed becomes the subject line of the 2FA code email that is sent out to the destinationAddress.
        params.method - String Optional Default - "sms". Type of the authentication code delivery method, sms and email are supported types. Possible values: sms, email
        params.expiry - String Optional Default - 120. Lifetime duration of the code sent in seconds. This can contain values between 30 and 3600 seconds.
        params.length - String Optional Default - 6. Length of the authentication code tha CPaaS should generate for this request. It can contain values between 4 and 10.
        params.type - String Optional Default - "numeric". Type of the code that is generated. If not provided, default value is numeric. Possible values: numeric, alphanumeric, alphabetic
        Returns:
        Twofactor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception raised
